channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: From Bananas as Art to Bullets: Maurizio Cattelan’s Got a Gun Show
item.description: From bananas as art to bullet-riddled panels: The Italian artist, in a rare in-person interview, tells why he turned his sardonic gaze on a violence-filled world.

item.title: Moulin Rouge’s Windmill Blades Fall Off in Paris
item.description: Firefighters were called overnight after the blades crashed to the ground. Nobody was hurt, and the famed cabaret venue will stay open.

item.title: 'Americans just work harder' than Europeans, says CEO of Norway's $1.6 trillion oil fund, because they have a higher 'general level of ambition'
item.description: "We are not very ambitious. I should be careful about talking about work-life balance, but the Americans just work harder.”

item.title: The Crackdown on Student Protesters
item.description: Columbia University is at the center of a growing showdown over the war in Gaza and the limits of free speech.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.N. Official Presses for Urgent Action on Gaza Aid
item.description: Sigrid Kaag, the U.N. aid coordinator for Gaza, said Israel had taken steps to improve relief deliveries but called for further measures.

item.title: It’s not just investors watching the Fed
item.description: A stronger U.S. dollar can lead to more pressure on currencies in emerging economies which could then trap their respective central banks in a bind.

item.title: Supreme Court to Hear Trump Immunity Case, and Campus Protests Spread
Mining Giant BHP Makes $39 Billion Bid for Rival Anglo American
item.description: The deal would create one of the largest copper miners at a time when demand is soaring for the metal used in many green technologies.

item.title: Ask Andy: How can a startup founder balance work and family?
item.description: Bonobos founder Andy Dunn answers questions about juggling entrepreneurship and parenthood, and about how to organize a fast-growing startup team.

item.title: Juggling Campaign and Foreign Policy, Biden Sends Complicated Messages
item.description: The president signed a bill that could ban TikTok even as his re-election team uses it to reach young voters. It was hardly the first internal disparity on matters around the globe.

item.title: Biden’s New Power Plant Rules: 5 Things to Know
item.description: The Biden administration released a major climate regulation aimed at virtually eliminating carbon emissions from coal, the dirtiest of the fossil fuels and a driver of global warming.

item.title: A new Cold War is brewing at sea–and the West’s security and prosperity are at stake
item.description: Maritime shipping accounts for 90% of all world trade.

item.title: Biden, Seeking to Build on Fruitful Week, Will Announce Billions in Chip Grants
item.description: The $6.1 billion for Micron, to shore up the domestic supply of semiconductors, comes after a key union endorsement and passage of an aid bill central to the president’s foreign policy agenda.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia’s Battle Over the Town of Chasiv Yar, Explained
item.description: Chasiv Yar has been under relentless attack by Russian forces. Controlling the town would put them in striking distance of key Ukrainian operational and supply centers.

item.title: AstraZeneca encounters a surge in shares as profits exceed expectations, buoyed by demand for cancer drugs
item.description: Astra's shares rose as much as 6.5% in early London trading, the most in over three years.
